title: 246 OLED LG TVS!!! CES 2018 - LG, Sony, Razer and Intel
description: PLEASE SUBSCRIBE:  GET MY PINK iJUSTINE CABLES HERE:   GET MY EDITING PLUGIN:    MUSIC I USE -   FRIEND ME HERE:        MY NEW PROJECT:   PODCAST:       WHAT I USE TO MAKE VIDEOS    CAMERAS: Sony a7 IV -  Sony a1 -   Sony a7s III -   Insta 360 ONE X3 -  Insta 360 ONE RS -  Insta 360 GO2 -   LENSES: New Sony GM 24-70mm ii -  Older Sony GM 24-70mm -  New Sony Sony 20-70mm -  Sony GM 16-35mm -  Sony GM 50mm -  Sony GM 135mm -  Sony GM 85mm -   AUDIO:  Sennheiser AVX Digital Wireless -  Sony XLR Adapter -  Sony Hot Shoe Shotgun -  Tiny Sony Microphone -  DJI Mics -  Rode Podcaster Pro II -  Podcaster Mic -  Elgato Wave 3 Mic -   DRONES: DJI Mavic 3 -  DJI Mini 3 -  DJI Air 2S -   LIGHTING: Aputure 600d Pro -  Aputure Light Dome II -  Aputure Amaran 200d -  Aputure 35in Light Dome -  Aputure Lantern Softbox -   Sony CF Express A 160g + Card Reader-  Sony CF Express A 800g -     These links are affiliate and by using them youre helping out my channel! Thank you!     BECOME A CHANNEL MEMBER:
transcript: (upbeat electronic music) - We're inside this LG tunnel, there are 246 55-inch televisions inside of this tunnel, and it has all of the Dolby Atmos surround sound. So it really feels like you are in these places, like we are right now soaring in the sky. (upbeat electronic music) This is the LG CLOi, now these are concept robots that can do multiple things. There's one to bring you room service, there's one that can potentially check you into your hotel, and there's one that may one day replace shopping carts. One of the key things that I've noticed here at CES this year is integrating Google and Alexa into other things. This is all using Google Assistant, you don't even have to say hey Google. And it's integrated into the remote. Change light brightness to 100 percent. Change lights to blue. Search YouTube videos for iJustine. Oh, what do you know? So basically, you can use the remote control for your television, to control your lights, to control your entire home. So basically, change the color of the lights, turn on the air purifier, I can turn on the air conditioner. This is why I don't ever have to leave my house. (calm electronic music) This is actually a pretty cool demo. People have TVs in different locations, it's really hard to be able to see from different angles. With these, they have an accurate color angle. So, no matter what angle you're at, you can see all the colors at much more of a true depth. So the bottom is conventional, and this is the top, where you can see the accurate color angles. (calm electronic music) We're heading in to get a demo of this 4K HDR projector. You can scale this up to 150 inches, wow! (crowd chatting) This is actually shocking in the picture quality, because this looks like a television but it is a projector. The colors are so vibrant. The lifespan of this projector is over 20 thousand hours. Basically, you can watch this projector for eight hours a day, for seven years straight. I could spend my time quite wisely watching plenty of Netflix shows on this thing. (relaxed electronic music) You guys know I'm always struggling with monitor solutions, and I'm trying out so many. I've seen a bunch of people try the ultra wide monitors, and I think they may be the solution that I need for editing. (relaxed electronic music) Basically, just taking a little rest here at CES, a CES siesta! Siesta? Siesta. I'm getting such inspiration goals, from all of these mock living rooms. Why can I not be an adult? And why does my house never look nice? (relaxed electronic music) We made it to the Sony booth, let's go check it out! (crowd cheering) I'm shook. I've run into so many people this trip. Okay you can... Do you wanna... So this here is like a little timeline of the past several years of Sony cameras. It's showing where they started from, and where they are now! You know, kind of like that Drake song, started from the bottom now we're here. Jenna, did you see this? They have an A9 with a new Sony RX0 on top of it. It's their tiny, new little action camera that you guys have seen me talk about. They also have a bunch of different adapters and cages for this thing too. So you basically take this RX0, and do so many different things with it. They have a filter adaptor, a cage, they have housing, the camera control box, there's the camera itself. Here is a tear-down of everything that's inside of it, and this is a really, I hate to say it, I don't like saying aesthetic, but this is a very aesthetically pleasing tear-down photo. He can recognize up to five family members. - Imagine there being like seven people in your family, so two of them it's like sorry! (laughing) Wait, remember when you thought dogs only had three toes? This one does! - [Justine] He does actually. - [Jenna] This is your dog! - [Justine] This is. Depending upon how a person treats the dog, it'll respond differently. So if Jenna is nicer to the dog than I am, it's gonna like you more. So, this is Aibo, it isn't concept, it's actually a real product. They said that you can only get it right now in Japan, and it's sold out. So maybe, we just go to Japan, and maybe we can find one? - Should we camp out? - Look, he's even got little toys too! So, this is his little puppy pad. And if it's blocked and he can't find it, he has a little tiny camera on his little butt right here, that'll use the ceiling, and he'll be able to navigate his way back home. Because he can tell, and remember, that there are two lights on the ceiling. Every night from eight to 10, they are flying these at the Bellagio, and it is amazing that I'm holding one right in my hand. Surprisingly, this thing is very light. Here's your drone back, thank you! - [Man] You're welcome. What's great is, I think CES is more about the people, like seeing everybody. When was the last time we met, was New York? - New York, yeah. So, we're at the DJI booth, and they announced the Osmo Mobile 2, and the Ronin S, did you get a chance to check it out yet? - I have checked out both, there's going to be two version of it. So this one, the one that they've got is for the DSLRs, but they're going to have a smaller version for mirrorlesses apparently, and I think that might be a bit more manageable. - [Justine] Awesome, well thanks for being in my video! - Thank you for having me, it's so awesome to see you. - I'm gonna put my microphone back now, okay bye. So, you guys know I'm a huge Hue light bulb fan, but guess what? And I can also position them based on how they're physically located in my room. - [Justine] That's so cool, I've actually never even seen the speakers before, those are awesome. - Yeah, those are actually our brand new speakers we just launched on Tuesday. - [Justine] Okay, that's probably why I haven't seen them. I was like how did I not know? - So, do you have a favorite song, or a jam? Or even you want to pop up your channel. - [Justine] DMX. ("X Gon' Give It To Ya" by DMX) Oh my goodness! This isn't the censored version! - [Jenna] This is the bad one! X gon' give it to ya Knock knock, open up the door it's real With the non-stop pop pop of stainless steel - I usually listen to the censored version. So I'm a little shocked because it's been a while since I've heard the full remix. (laughing) Alright guys, that does it for CES 2018. We are about to now embark on a journey back home to LA, and we're driving, so wish us luck. Unfortunately, I don't have a self-driving car. But, that's alright, maybe in the future. Oh gosh, how long do you think it's gonna take, Jen? - [Jenna] A long time. - Alright. - [Man] Can I get a picture with you? - [Justine] Yes, of course! (upbeat pop music)
